channel.title: Comments on: Running older compatibility levels in newer versions
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Johnson
item.dc:creator: Johnson
item.description: Great article! I have gone through the points discussed in it. Very informative. Also you can go through this article: <a href="http://www.sqlmvp.org/sql-server-database-compatibility-level-performance/" rel="nofollow">http://www.sqlmvp.org/sql-server-database-compatibility-level-performance/</a>
item.content:encoded: Great article! I have gone through the points discussed in it. Very informative. Also you can go through this article: http://www.sqlmvp.org/sql-server-database-compatibility-level-performance/

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Ha, I just noticed a DB in 2005 compatibility level on a 2008 server...someone just never bothered to upgrade it to 2008...and of course nobody will now since it might break stuff
item.content:encoded: Ha, I just noticed a DB in 2005 compatibility level on a 2008 server…someone just never bothered to upgrade it to 2008…and of course nobody will now since it might break stuff
